content: Architecture (DRDA). DRDA enables relational data to be distributed among multiple systems. It is native to Db2 for z/OS, which reduces the need for more gateway products that can affect performance and availability. The application uses the DRDA requester or server to access a remote database. IBM Db2 Connect is an example of a DRDA application requester. 12 z/OS V2R2 and later (older z/OS versions are out of support) 110 IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ Technical Guide  Star schema query processing, which is mostly used in business intelligence work. A star schema is a relational database schema for representing multidimensional data. It stores data in a central fact table and is surrounded by more dimension tables that hold information about each perspective of the data. For example, a star schema query joins various dimensions of a star schema data set.  Db2 utilities that are used for index maintenance, such as LOAD, REORG, and REBUILD. Indexes allow quick access to table rows.
